intro: Monnina graminea, commonly known as slender blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue or purple flowers. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaf arrangement. Monnina graminea is often found in the western United States and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
